sen.e: The cherry trees within the precinct, called "Jishu-zakura", are well-known for their beautiful blossoms and are also known as "Mikuruma-gaeshi-no-Sakura" (lit. cherry trees that make the imperial carriage come back) as their beauty caused Emperor Saga to have his carriage turned around three times to view the flowers when he visited in the year 811.
